question: How do we pass Physical Education at Innopolis University?
answer: Education Department sets a minimum of credit units required to pass a PE test. This information is depicted in Moodle. Student has to accumulate a certain number of attendance hours in Sports Complex of Innopolis, as well as has to pass the standards before the deadline.
generated_answer:
### Answer to Question: How do I propose an elective course?

To propose an elective course, you need to provide information about the course as follows:

1. Title of the course
2. A brief description of the course
3. Prerequisites needed for your course
4. Intended learning outcomes
5. A list of topics that will be covered during the course.

You can also provide links to GitHub repos, presentations, etc.

The deadline for proposing a course is April 10th for the Summer term and June 15th for the Fall term. Please submit your proposals to bmp@innopolis.university. You can also message if you have any questions.

question: When can I start visiting the Sports Complex?
answer: From the 1st of September, after you are officially enrolled.
generated_answer: Based on the available information, you can start visiting the Sports Complex after you are officially enrolled in Innopolis University. The file path ../data/raw/raw\_faq\_Academic.md provides this information.

question: When do we have retakes at Innopolis University?
answer: Student is offered two retakes, the dates are scheduled by Education Department. Information is delivered to student's @innopolis.ru
generated_answer: Retakes at Innopolis University occur when a student does not meet the passing requirements of a course during the first attempt. The exact rules for retaking courses can vary depending on the subject, but in general, students are allowed to retake a course once if they did not pass it with a satisfactory grade. The deadline for retakes is typically set by the Education Department and is usually within one year of completing the first attempt. If a student fails a course twice or more, they may be required to withdraw from the program or find an alternative course to complete their degree requirements.

question: What to do if I got ill before an exam and couldn't prepare properly?
answer: In this case you have notify Education Department and Student Affairs Department: write to 319@innopolis.ru, present original documents confirming your health condition, write an application to ask to move the date of your individual exam due to health issues. This application will be considered on an individual basis.
generated_answer: If you got sick before an exam and couldn’t prepare properly, you can contact your course instructor and explain your situation. They may be able to offer a solution such as rescheduling the exam or providing additional resources for you to review. It is also worth noting that some universities have policies regarding accommodations for students with disabilities or illnesses, so it may be worth checking if this is something that applies to your situation. Additionally, you may want to consider reaching out to a student services department or counselor at the university for support and guidance during this time.

question: Who can take part in exchange programs?

question: Where can I find information about exchange programs?
answer:
1) by sending your request to international@innopolis.university
2) by visiting International Relations Office in room 503 A
3) by visiting innopolis.university/en/outgoingstudents
generated_answer:
You can find information about exchange programs organized by Innopolis University by visiting their website at <https://innopolis.university/en/outgoingstudents/>. From there, you can explore the available academic mobility programs and summer/winter schools, as well as their application requirements.

Additionally, there are several international summer schools listed that offer exchange programs. You can learn more about these programs by visiting their respective websites:

1. IX INTERNATIONAL SUMMER SCHOOL at Ural Federal University - <https://www.urfugov.ru/en/international-relations/education/exchange-programs>
2. INNSBRUCK SUMMER SCHOOL OF ALPINE RESEARCH at the University of Innsbruck - <https://www.innsbrucksummerschool.at/>
3. LUT SUMMER SCHOOL at the Lappeenranta University of Technology - <https://summer.lut.fi/>
4. GINSEN SUMMER SCHOOL at Grenoble INP – UGA - <https://www.grenoble-inp.fr/en/formation/summer-schools/ginsen>
5. ESME & EPITECH - SUMMER SCHOOL IN ROBOTICS at Ecole Spéciale de Mécanique et d'Electricité( ESME) - <https://www.esme-espe.fr/en/summer-schools/>
6. SUMMER SCHOOL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE & ENGINEERING APPLIED TO SMART CITIES at ESTP Paris - École Spéciale des Travaux Publics, du Bâtiment et de l'Industrie - <https://www.estp.fr/fr/en/summer-schools/>
7. SUMMER SCHOOL IN VISUAL COMPUTING & ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE at CY Cergy Paris Universite - <https://cy.cergy.edu/en/summer-school/>
8. SAPIENZA SUMMER SCHOOLS at the Sapienza University of Rome - <https://internationaloffice.uniroma1.it/content/summer-schools>
9. SUMMER SCHOOL & CONFERENCE at the University of L'Aquila - <https://www.unilaquila.it/international/>
10. GSSI-SIF-INAF SUMMER SCHOOL ON COSMIC RAYS at Gran Sasso Science Institute (GSSI) - <https://www.gssi.it/summer-schools/>

question: When do applications for exchange programs open?
answer: Applications are open at the beginning of each semester. International Relations Office will send an email to all students about the beginning of the application campaign and step-by-step guide to application process.
generated_answer: The application period for exchange programs may vary depending on the program and university. Undergraduate exchange programs usually open during the early part of the academic year, in the fall semester (typically late August or early September) or spring semester (late March or early April). Graduate exchange programs typically open during the spring or summer of the academic year and short-term programs like summer camps or study abroad programs that last only a few weeks usually open during the spring or summer of the academic year. Study abroad programs, designed specifically for students who want to study at another university in a different country, usually open during the fall or spring semester and students will need to submit their application by the end of the academic year in order to be considered for these programs. It's best to check with the specific website of the university you are interested in for more information on when exchange programs open and how to apply.

question: Will I be getting IU scholarship for the time of the exchange semester?
answer: Yes, exchange students continue to receive scholarships. The scholarship is awarded based on the results of the intermediate results of the semester preceding the exchange semester.
generated_answer: It is not mentioned in the context information provided whether or not you will receive an IU scholarship for the duration of your exchange semester. You should check the entry requirements and financial support options available at the partner university where you plan to exchange, as well as any specific scholarships or funding opportunities that may be available through Innopolis University for students participating in exchange programs. It is also recommended to review the handbook 9.5 Exchange Opportunities and 8 Scholarships & Financial Support for more information on financial support options available at Innopolis University.

question: How can I change my study group?
answer:
1. Fill out an application form indicating the reason of study group change and bring it to 319 or send it to @StudentAffairs_bot (only if you are not in Russian Federation)
2. Wait for the response that will be provided via email.
generated_answer: You can change your study group by filling out an application form indicating the reason of study group change and submitting it to either 319 or via @StudentAffairs\_bot (if you are not in Russian Federation). You should also wait for the response that will be provided via email.
